Title: Characterizing the roles of classes and their fault-proneness through change metrics
Published: Empirical Software Engineering and Measurement (ESEM), 2012 ACM-IEEE International Symposium on
Elements_risk_assessment: we can assume that in most cases we will at least have a reasonable connection between bug-introducing and bug-fixing commits.
UseOF-SZZ: Finding the origin of the bug
Summary:
We discussed the problems of different levels of granularity. Our method begins at a high level of detail and then differentiates 
    between files based on the temporal characteristics of their changes.
Outcome: The measure of structural change in concert with its complement, churn, effectively indicates fault-proneness in classes.
